snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is only one player in addressing the issue in the city, but decisions his administration has made have left the city shouldering more of the burden.
abstract: Review of New York State government's efforts on homelessness since Gov Andrew M Cuomo took office reveals pattern of shifting burden onto New York City, even as issue has grown more dire; Cuomo's administration says much of struggle in city's handling of issue is due to bad management on part of city.

byline.original: By NIKITA STEWART and VIVIAN YEE

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is only one player in addressing the issue in the city, but decisions his administration has made have left the city shouldering more of the burden.

headline.main: As Cuomo Acts on Homeless Problem, New York City Blames State Cuts
headline.print_headline: As Cuomo Acts on Homelessness, City Blames State Cuts
